intro: Leandra sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-leaved mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive, almost spherical appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
